slides.title: Favicon
slides.content:
# Favicons üîñ

A favicon is a small image displayed next to the page title in the browser tab.

```html
<head>
  <link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="/images/favicon.ico">
</head>
```

- Common formats: `.ico`, `.png`, `.svg`.

slides.title: Advanced Video
slides.content:
# Video Attributes üé¨

More control over HTML5 video.

- `autoplay`: Starts playing automatically.
- `loop`: Replays indefinitely.
- `muted`: Starts muted (often required for autoplay to work).
- `poster`: An image to show while downloading.
- `preload`: Hint to browser (`auto`, `metadata`, `none`).

```html
<video controls muted poster="thumb.jpg">
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
</video>
```

slides.title: YouTube Embeds
slides.content:
# Embedding YouTube üì∫

The easiest way to play videos is to use YouTube.

1. Upload video to YouTube.
2. Click 'Share' -> 'Embed'.
3. Copy the `<iframe>` code.

```html
<iframe width="420" height="315"
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tgbNymZ7vqY">
</iframe>
```

> üí° **Autoplay:** Add `?autoplay=1` to the URL (might still be blocked by browser policies unless muted).

slides.title: Audio Formats
slides.content:
# Audio Formats üéµ

Not all browsers support all formats.

| Format | Media Type | Browser Support |
|--------|------------|----------------|
| MP3 | audio/mpeg | All modern browsers |
| WAV | audio/wav | All modern browsers |
| Ogg | audio/ogg | Firefox, Chrome, Opera |

```html
<audio controls>
  <source src="horse.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
  <source src="horse.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
```

slides.title: Object and Embed
slides.content:
# Object & Embed üî©

The `<object>` and `<embed>` elements are containers for external applications or interactive content (plugins).

```html
<embed src="snippet.html">
<embed src="pic_trulli.jpg">

<object data="snippet.html"></object>
<object data="pic_trulli.jpg"></object>
```

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Most browsers no longer support Java Applets and Plug-ins. Stick to `<video>`, `<audio>`, and `<iframe>`.
